titleStmt.title: George Rennecker, John D. Rennecker, and William Rennecker, Bond
CWG4631

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Be it remembered that Geo. Rennecker William Renancker and John D. Rennecker this day personally appeared before us G. W. Salyers and N. Green Justices of the peace for said county and severally acknowledged themselves indebted to the commonwealth of Kentucky in the sum of one thousand dollars- that is to say the said Geo. Renneker in the sum of five hundred dollars; and the said Willliam Rennecker & John D. Rennecker in the sum of two hundred fifty dollars each to be levied of their respective lands & tenements goods and chattles- but to be void on the said George Rennecker personally appearing in the circuit court for the county aforesaid on the first day of their town and surrendering himself in custody to answer to the commonwealth for shooting with the intent to kill Elisha Isaacs- with which the said George Rennecker stands charged before us.

George Rennecker
J. D. Rennecker
Wm Rennecker

acknowledged before us this 2d day of April 1864.
G. W. Salyers J. P. G. C.
N. Green J. P. G. C.
A copy att N. H. Jeffers Clk. Grant Cir. Ct.
